intro: Hieracium caesiotinctum, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive blue tinge, and it produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium caesiotinctum is often considered a weed but has ornamental value due to its unique appearance.
